explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 13degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 1999) and the boiling point is 83.5degC, which is classified into Category 2. Classified into Class 3 and Division 6.1 (UN#1184) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; the auto-ignition temperature is 413degC (ICSC, 1999)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 and Division 6.1 (UN#1184) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 695mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 680mg/kg (EHC 62, 1987), 850mg/kg (EHC 62, 1987) and 967mg/kg (SIDS, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the testing data of rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 4,890mg/kg (SIDS (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 value (4 hours) of 1,000ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 4 mg/L (6 hours) (EHC 62 (1987)), 6.6mg/L (7.25 hours) (EHC 62 (1987)), 3.29mg/L (10 hours) (SIDS (2002)), and 6.77mg/L (6 hours) (SIDS (2002)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapor concentration (80,500ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 8.13kPa (20degC) (CERI Hazard Data 96-20 (1997)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.3 (2004)): "moderate irritant."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on human epidemiological studies and rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.3 (2004): The results of Draize tests suggest "mild irritation."

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests), the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (mouse spot tests), and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in SIDS (2004), IARC 71 (1999), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.3 (2004), and EHC 176 (1995), according to the technical guideline (Appendix 1).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 2B by IARC (1999), Category B2 by IRIS (2005), and Category R by NTP (2005).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.3 (2004): Reproductive mouse toxicity tests, rat one-generation tests and rat and rabbit teratogenicity tests show no effects on the embryo.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system, liver, kidney, adrenal gland), Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (central nervous system, liver, kidney, adrenal gland) May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "crouching position, confusion, staggering gait, hyperkinesias, tremor, somnolency, clouding of consciousness, coma, hemorrhagic diathesis, cyanosis, hepatic necrosis, tubulonecrosis, adrenal necrosis, circulatory system disorder" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.3 (2004)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, liver, thyroid) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "neurosis, myeloradiculitis, hepatic disease, cholepathia, autonomic ataxia, bronchocele, hyperthyroidism, inertia" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.3 (2004)), and the evidence from animal studies including "reversible degeneration of the renal tubular epithelium" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.3 (2004)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour LC50=94mg/L of the fish (Bluegill) (SIDS (2004) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although the acute toxicity was Category 3, judging from NOEC=29000microg/L during 28 days of the fish (Fathead minnows) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2, 2003), it was classified into Not classified.
